intro: Passerina lessertii, commonly known as the lesser pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its showy, often colorful blooms. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It produces small, usually yellow or white flowers with five petals, and its leaves are simple and trifoliate. Passerina lessertii is often found in meadows and open slopes at high elevations.
